meanings.definition: The act of changing the direction or position of something.
meanings.sent1: After the storm, the reorientation of the fallen tree was necessary to clear the road.
meanings.sent2: The reorientation of the map helped us find our way back home.
meanings.sent3: The reorientation of the furniture in the room made it look like a whole new space.
meanings.sent4: His reorientation towards a healthier lifestyle brought positive changes to his well-being.
meanings.sent5: The reorientation of the compass needle pointed us in the right direction.

meanings.definition: The process of adjusting to a new situation or perspective.
meanings.sent1: The reorientation to online classes required students to adapt to a different learning environment.
meanings.sent2: Her reorientation to the new job took some time, but she eventually found her rhythm.
meanings.sent3: The reorientation to a world without smartphones seemed like a daunting challenge for the teenager.
meanings.sent4: The reorientation to a different culture opened her eyes to new customs and traditions.
meanings.sent5: His reorientation to the concept of time made him appreciate each moment more.
